admission_text:
# Membership

* * *

## **Join the Stevens County Historical Society!**

Membership in the Stevens County Historical Society, located in Morris, Minnesota, makes a wonderful gift for parents, children or relatives who may have moved away from the area, but still have an interest in the history of Stevens County.  
  
**[](https://stevenscounty.square.site/shop/4)  
**

## **SCHS Membership Levels and Benefits**

### $150 Platinum Level:

  * A behind-the-scenes tour of our museum (watch for event dates to be announced)
  * All the benefits below

### $100 Gold Level:

  * ROAM membership (more info below)
  * 10% discount in our museum Gift Shop by showing your membership card
  * All the benefits below

### $75 Silver Level:

  * 1 hour of free research
  * Usage of our research room
  * Benefit below

### $50 Bronze Level:

  * 6 issues of the _The Prairie Outlook_ newsletter

[](https://stevenscounty.square.site/shop/4)  

* * *

## **What is ROAM?**

The [Reciprocal Organizations of Associated Museums (ROAM)](https://sites.google.com/site/roammuseums/) is designed to offer membership benefits when you travel to other museums across North America.   
  
What does this mean for you? If you are a member of SCHS at the Historians level, you have access to the benefit of free basic admission at over 300 participating museums around the United States and Canada. Keep this in mind when making travel plans! A few examples include:   
  
Walker Art Center - Minneapolis, MN  
Museu...
collections_text:
## Welcome to the Stevens County Historical Society and Museum!

Our mission is to collect, preserve, and interpret the history of Stevens County, Minnesota.

Located in Morris, Minnesota, the Stevens County Historical Society (SCHS) works to collect the best examples of historical artifacts of life on the prairie. 

Today, our 300+ members and hundreds of visitors each year embody the spirit of those who came before. Their generosity, inventiveness, and hard work provide hope for the bright future of West Central Minnesota.
